listitem.para: Reads one byte from the currently open port and outputs it as an integer from -128 to 127. It also outputs "-1" if no character is available. Therefore, if PORTREADCHAR outputs -1, it could be there was no character available or that it successfuly read the -1 byte. For this reason, if -1 is a possible byte in the data your program expects, then it's better to use PORTREADARRAY.

listitem.programlisting: PORTOPEN "com1 SHOW PORTWRITECHAR ASCII "a 1 SHOW PORTWRITECHAR ASCII "t 1 SHOW PORTWRITECHAR 13 1 WAIT 60 PRINT "Reading... Reading... REPEAT 10 [MAKE "x PORTREADCHAR IF NOT :x = -1 [TYPE CHAR :x]] PRINT ". at|| OK| . PORTCLOSE
